Question
========

In a Linear Mixed Model, the following estimate of variance is found for the regression coefficient of Time: 25.25 (se=12.12). Run the appropriate Wald test (as also given in the SPSS output for Mixed Models) to test whether there is significant variation in the effect of Time. 
Answerlist
----------
* $Chi^{2} = 4.34$. The $Chi^{2}$ value found is greater than 3.84, so the corresponding *p* value is less than .05. This means that there is significant variation in effect of time though.
* $Chi^{2} = 4.34$. The found $Chi^{2}$-value is greater than 3.84, so the corresponding *p* value is greater than .05. This means that there is no significant variation in effect of time.
* $z = 2.08$. The found z-waarde is groter dan 1.96, dus de bijbehorende *p*-waarde groter dan .05. Dit betekent dat er geen significante variatie is in effect van tijd.
* $z = 2.08$. The found z-waarde is groter dan 1.96, dus de bijbehorende *p*-waarde kleiner dan .05. Dit betekent dat er wel significante variatie is in effect van tijd.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Correct
